definition: to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

sentences.english: And the big money is with the brand advertisers.
sentences.chinese: 而且大品牌廣告商擁有更多的廣告費用。

sentences.english: Can Delete or edite a Advertiser Ad.
sentences.chinese: 管理員可以查看廣告商和出版商。

sentences.english: Advertising language is a means for the addresser to attract the addressee.
sentences.chinese: 廣告語是廣告商用來吸引廣大用戶的一種手段。

sentences.english: Propers Profits have been shrinking has as newspapers lose readers and appertizers advertisers to competition from new media.
sentences.chinese: 和新媒體競爭報紙失去了讀者和廣告商利潤就下降。

sentences.english: The key to our success is to develop the market and to attract advertisers to post.
sentences.chinese: 我們成功的關鍵是開拓市場並且吸引更多的廣告商。
傳統廣告商“不能再忽視電視購物。

sentences.english: Advertisers are now forbidden to deceive customers with false claims.
sentences.chinese: 現在已禁止廣告商用不實之詞來欺騙消費者。

sentences.english: We are bombarded by advertisers and inundated with fast food joints.
sentences.chinese: 我們被廣告商投放的垃圾食品廣告以及快餐店淹沒了。

sentences.english: None of this means that advertisers just have to turn the audio dials and consumers will come running.
sentences.chinese: 這並不意味着廣告商只需調高聲音就能吸引消費者。
無廣告商控制或廣播的電視。

sentences.english: The advertisers just stopped making payments to the fraudulent Websites.
sentences.chinese: 而廣告商也只是對這些造假站點拒付廣告款項。

sentences.english: Liaises with advertising and public relation agencies.
sentences.chinese: 建立，保持與廣告商和公共關係組織的關係。

sentences.english: Disappointments mounted as she answered many help-wanted ads, only to be turned down because of age limitations.
sentences.chinese: 當她回答許多招聘廣告商時，其失望之情便油然而增。

sentences.english: It is not known what, if anything, the advertisers did with this information.
sentences.chinese: 但是廣告商利用這些信息做了什麼我們一無所知。

sentences.english: They want our personal information to dangle in front of advertisers.
sentences.chinese: 他們想用我們的個人信息同廣告商們周旋。

definition: to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
employee/person employed in a trade or profession
